@petunia18 wow, that's impressive. I find that 24 works for me and I can get to most important messages more quickly. #w2
@JessicaSchimm @women2 @yes yes I do but that doesn't work for everyone. It's too distracting for some. #w2
@women2 that is really really hard to do well. I have humans who help put them in a database for me.
@baatenosh I agree. Google Now on Android does that very well. As does slice for packages on iOS.
@arizvii @Streak used it for awhile, didnt stick for me. #w2
@petunia18 setting expectations is hard, changing them is harder. What is your target response time? Mine is 24h or less. #w2
@artimsharma @women2 maybe tweak your notifications so they create less anxiety? #w2
@women2 @jeff sets a high bar for all of us in terms of email responsiveness. I take my cues from him actually. He's very good #w2
@MaplesTrees @women2 boomerang, yesware, rapportive are all great.  #w2
@yes @women2 I keep it open all day in the background #w2
@women2 avoid doing email last in first touched. After triage I go to my task list and do one high priority task. Then back to emails. #w2
@women2 as a VC, portfolio Co emails and those from @jeff, @stephpalmeri or LPs are priority. As a founder, it was team  emails first #w2
@baatenosh I think it depends on your company and role. I don't feel obligated to respond to all emails from strangers
@shaherose @women2 I ignore emails that aren't relevant to me or are likely to get solved wo my input. And many unsolicited intros too #w2
@women2 first thing I do is scan and archive anything that doesn't require action. Then I scan subject lines for easy looking ones. #w2
@women2 so Inbox Freedom is about getting people in the habit of taking action on email more quickly w less wasted effort. #w2
@women2 I think most people lack a strategy for tackling email. Most email can be dealt with  quickly (make a task, archive, ignore). #w2
@women2 I prefer the term inbox freedom, which is more about getting most things out of your inbox as opposed to focusing on the zero #w2
@women2 hello! Happy to be here to chat! #w2
